## Public Constructors

### LiveRangeEdit() {#a704fd862d35d9131d49d21eb04bea6a2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>llvm::LiveRangeEdit::LiveRangeEdit (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveinterval">LiveInterval</a> &#42; parent, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> &gt; &amp; newRegs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveintervals">LiveIntervals</a> &amp; lis, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/virtregmap">VirtRegMap</a> &#42; vrm, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liverangeedit/delegate">Delegate</a> &#42; delegate=nullptr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrset">SmallPtrSet</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &#42;, 32 &gt; &#42; deadRemats=nullptr)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Create a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liverangeedit">LiveRangeEdit</a> for breaking down parent into smaller pieces.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="parent">The register being spilled or split.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="newRegs">List to receive any new registers created. This needn&#39;t be empty initially, any existing registers are ignored.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="MF">The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> the live range edit is taking place in.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="lis">The collection of all live intervals in this function.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="vrm">Map of virtual registers to physical registers for this function. If NULL, no virtual register map updates will be done. This could be the case if called before Regalloc.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="deadRemats">The collection of all the instructions defining an original reg and are dead after remat.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/liverangeedit-h/#l00128">128</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/liverangeedit-h">LiveRangeEdit.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

### anyRematerializable() {#aff06b5e0f98141b098d89db4e93f472b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool LiveRangeEdit::anyRematerializable ()">
anyRematerializable - Return true if any parent values may be rematerializable.

This function must be called before any rematerialization is attempted.

### eliminateDeadDefs() {#add47e6d974ce584ea3fa3fc80ee34259}

<MemberDefinition

eliminateDeadDefs - Try to delete machine instructions that are now dead (allDefsAreDead returns true).

This may cause live intervals to be trimmed and further dead efs to be eliminated. RegsBeingSpilled lists registers currently being spilled by the register allocator. These registers should not be split into new intervals as currently those new intervals are not guaranteed to spill.

### pop&#95;back() {#ae900d06706a552fb8fa8c34a47d294f7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::LiveRangeEdit::pop&#95;back ()</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
pop&#95;back - It allows <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liverangeedit">LiveRangeEdit</a> users to drop new registers.

The context is when an original def instruction of a register is dead after rematerialization, we still want to keep it for following rematerializations. We save the def instruction in DeadRemats, and replace the original dst register with a new dummy register so the live range of original dst register can be shrinked normally. We don&#39;t want to allocate phys register for the dummy register, so we want to drop it from the NewRegs set.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/liverangeedit-h/#l00163">163</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/liverangeedit-h">LiveRangeEdit.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### rematerializeAt() {#ad2480b715c870bd7fc306f70c3fa1dc8}

<MemberDefinition

rematerializeAt - Rematerialize RM.ParentVNI into DestReg by inserting an instruction into MBB before MI.

The new instruction is mapped, but liveness is not updated. If ReplaceIndexMI is not null it will be replaced by new MI in the index map. Return the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> of the new instruction.
